clinical_study.brief_title: Improvement of Communicational Skills Between Health Workers and Oncological Patients During Medical Consultative Conversations
clinical_study.official_title: Ways to Improve the Efficiency of Communication Between Health Workers and Oncological Patients During Medical Consultative Conversations: an Observational Clinical Study

lead_sponsor.agency: I.M. Sechenov First Moscow State Medical University

clinical_study.source: I.M. Sechenov First Moscow State Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to identify the specific patterns of communication between doctors and oncological patients during medical consultations and develop recommendations to improve its effectiveness.

primary_outcome.measure: Identification the communication techniques used by the doctor in the counseling conversation;

arm_group.description: Histologically confirmed low-risk prostate cancer (PSA up to 10 ng / ml; Gleason (3 + 3) = 6 (ISUP 1); tumor stage T2a (low- risk according to the D'Amico scale))

intervention.intervention_name: Audio recording of the counseling conversation
intervention.description: The patient will have an audio-recorded counseling conversation. Audio recording will be carried out using a portable recorder ZOOM H2n. The audio recordings of the counseling conversations will be performed by the health workers selected to participate in the study.
